Deprecated API

Contents

  • Interfaces
  • Classes
  • Fields
  • Methods
  • Constructors
  • Deprecated Interfaces
    Interface
    Description
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.CopyOnWrite
    Since 2.24.0 no class implements this.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.LoggerRegistry.MapFactory
    As of version 2.25.0, planned to be removed!
  • Deprecated Classes
    Class
    Description
    org.apache.logging.log4j.EventLogger
    Deprecated since 2.24.0. Logger accepts StructuredDataMessages, users should use to that instead.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.LoggerContextKey
    with no replacement - no longer used
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.LoggerRegistry.ConcurrentMapFactory
    As of version 2.25.0, planned to be removed!
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.LoggerRegistry.WeakMapFactory
    As of version 2.25.0, planned to be removed!
  • Deprecated Fields
    Field
    Description
    org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager.FACTORY_PROPERTY_NAME
    Replaced since 2.24.0 with "log4j.provider".
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.Provider.FACTORY_PRIORITY
    since 2.24.0
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.Provider.LOGGER_CONTEXT_FACTORY
    since 2.24.0
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.Provider.THREAD_CONTEXT_MAP
    since 2.24.0
  • Deprecated Methods
    Method
    Description
    org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger.entry()
    Since 2.6, use Logger.traceEntry() instead which performs the same function.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger.entry(Object...)
    since 2.11.2, use Logger.traceEntry(String, Object...) instead which performs the same function.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger.exit()
    Since 2.6, use Logger.traceExit() instead which performs the same function.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger.exit(R)
    Since 2.6, use Logger.traceExit(Object) instead which performs the same function.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.MarkerManager.getMarker(String, String)
    Use the Marker add or set methods to add parent Markers. Will be removed by final GA release.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.MarkerManager.getMarker(String, Marker)
    Use the Marker add or set methods to add parent Markers. Will be removed by final GA release.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.message.Message.getFormat()
    Deprecated since version 2.24.0. Use MultiformatMessage instead to implement messages that can format themselves in one or more encodings.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.message.StructuredDataId.makeId(String, int)
    Since 2.18.0, use StructuredDataId.makeId(String, String) instead
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.AbstractLogger.checkMessageFactory(ExtendedLogger, MessageFactory)
    As of version 2.25.0, planned to be removed! Instead, in LoggerContext.getLogger(String, MessageFactory) implementations, namespace loggers with message factories. If your implementation uses LoggerRegistry, you are already covered.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.AbstractLogger.enter(String, String, MessageSupplier...)
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.AbstractLogger.enter(String, MessageSupplier)
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.AbstractLogger.entry()
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.AbstractLogger.entry(Object...)
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.AbstractLogger.exit()
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.AbstractLogger.exit(R)
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.LoggerRegistry.getLogger(String)
    As of version 2.25.0, planned to be removed! Use LoggerRegistry.getLogger(String, MessageFactory) instead.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.LoggerRegistry.hasLogger(String)
    As of version 2.25.0, planned to be removed! Use LoggerRegistry.hasLogger(String, MessageFactory) instead.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.Provider.getUrl()
    since 2.24.0, without a replacement.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.status.StatusConsoleListener.setFilters(String...)
    since 2.23.0, this method is ineffective and only kept for binary backward compatibility.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.status.StatusData.getTimestamp()
    since 2.23.0, use StatusData.getInstant() instead.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.status.StatusLogger.clear()
    Since 2.23.0, instead of relying on the buffering provided by StatusLogger, users should register their own listeners to access to logged events.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.status.StatusLogger.getStatusData()
    Since 2.23.0, instead of relying on the buffering provided by StatusLogger, users should register their own listeners to access to logged events.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.status.StatusLogger.setLevel(Level)
    Since 2.23.0, instead use the setLevel(Level) method on the fallback listener returned by StatusLogger.getFallbackListener().
    org.apache.logging.log4j.status.StatusLogger.updateListenerLevel(Level)
    Since 2.23.0, instead use the setLevel(Level) method on the fallback listener returned by StatusLogger.getFallbackListener().
    org.apache.logging.log4j.util.Base64Util.encode(String)
    since 2.22.0, use Base64 instead.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.util.PropertiesUtil.reload()
    since 2.24.0 caching of property values is disabled.
  • Deprecated Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    org.apache.logging.log4j.message.ParameterizedMessage(String, String[], Throwable)
    Since 2.6, use ParameterizedMessage(String, Object[], Throwable) instead
    org.apache.logging.log4j.message.StructuredDataId(String, int, String[], String[])
    Since 2.18.0, use StructuredDataId(String, String, String[], String[]) instead.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.message.StructuredDataId(String, int, String[], String[], int)
    Since 2.18.0, use StructuredDataId(String, String, String[], String[], int) instead.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.DefaultThreadContextMap(boolean)
    Since 2.24.0. Use NoOpThreadContextMap for a no-op implementation.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.DefaultThreadContextStack(boolean)
    since 2.24.0 without a replacement.
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.LoggerRegistry(LoggerRegistry.MapFactory<T>)
    As of version 2.25.0, planned to be removed!
    org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.Provider(Properties, URL, ClassLoader)
    since 2.24.0
